intro: Psyllium webbii, commonly known as the African psyllium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a mucilaginous substance from its seeds, which is used in traditional medicine and as a dietary supplement. Psyllium webbii thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its nutritional and medicinal properties. Its growth cycle is typically annual, with the plant reaching maturity within a few months.
